definition: profanity/obscene language/speaking rudely
dirty/filthy
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
to pour out obscenities/filthy mouthed

sentences.english: The Eagles prided themselves on being clean living, not using cuss words and treating each other with respect.
sentences.chinese: 老鷹隊自豪於自己的生活嚴謹，不說髒話，尊重他人。

sentences.english: Not like the foul-mouthed bunch today.
sentences.chinese: 可不像現在那些滿口髒話的年輕人。

sentences.english: I was stunned by his remarks full of vile curses.
sentences.chinese: 他的滿口髒話令我齒冷。

sentences.english: Swearing is a natural part of human speech development.
sentences.chinese: 說髒話是人類語言發展中很自然的一部分。

sentences.english: It is totally unacceptable for children to swear .
sentences.chinese: 孩子說髒話是完全不能容忍的。

sentences.english: He became abusive when he was drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他喝醉時就滿口髒話罵人了。

sentences.english: They shared movies, more fights, more cuss words.
sentences.chinese: 讓他們一起看電影，又打架罵髒話了。

sentences.english: In fact, today, i was going to talk about the "f-words", but i found that all of the explanations are too long.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，今天，我本來想要跟妳們說些法文的髒話。

sentences.english: I'm going to tell him the actual worst swearword in the world.
sentences.chinese: 我要告訴他世界上真正最噁心的髒話。

sentences.english: Itdisguises the word's origins just enough to keep the swearer clear of the law.
sentences.chinese: 它僞飾單詞的起源，使得髒話能夠不受法律的限制。

sentences.english: Foul-mouthed children should be severely punished.
sentences.chinese: 滿口髒話的孩子應該被嚴厲處罰。

sentences.english: And swore at her when she asked what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 當瑪莎問他什麼意思時，他還對她吐髒話。
請注意你的髒話，預科生。

sentences.english: Civilization on duty, being polite, do not say dirty words.
sentences.chinese: 文明執勤，禮貌待人，不講髒話。

sentences.english: And always work as a team — never contradicting statements of the other.
sentences.chinese: 始終保持團結，永遠不要和對方說髒話。

sentences.english: When the old latrine lips finishes shocking everyone, I have something to say.
sentences.chinese: 等那滿口髒話的老頭罵夠了，我就要講了。

definition: to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone
unpleasant to hear/coarse/vulgar/offensive/shameful
to scold/to abuse/to curse/CL:通[tong4],頓|顿[dun4]
usage (of a term)/wording/phrasing
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
truth
Zen saying repeated as cant/(fig.) catchphrase/mantra/favorite expression/stock phrase
to dislike/to loathe/disagreeable/troublesome/annoying
nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
to lie/to tell an untruth
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
not bad/tolerable/fortunately
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
